originalText.text: This review doesn't reflect the abilities of Dr. Armenakas who is a wonderful physician but the horrors of his office staff. My husband has been trying to secure his medical records for over two months. Despite repeated calls to Orlando who is the office manager there was never a response. Finally upon going to the office he filled out a form indicating authorization and after a few weeks an invoice in the amount of $76.75 was sent. We STILL do not have the medical forms which are critically needed in order to secure insurance. The receptionists are rude and unhelpful. Quality medical care is important but it is also important that when you need information there is a responsive staff capable of providing assistance.

originalText.text: Do NOT see his practice! Went there almost two years ago for a standard visit and he was not personable at all. I paid my copay and they showed up as a covered practice through my insurance. Additionally after two years, I get a bill for over $300! When I called, the receptionist was extremely rude and would not allow me to speak to the doctor regarding this. STAY AWAY!

originalText.text:
Saw Dr. Armenakas in November of  2016. Had a complicated urinary tract problem and he approached it with the careful detail. Had an MRI, a sonogram and cystoscopy ... all were normal. He. gave good explanations as why I needed each of these. Prescribed the correct antibiotic and the UTI cleared very soon. I am an M.D. myself and he has all the qualities to be on my short list of the best physicians that I have encountered in my 50+ years in medicine. I give him a strong recommendation.
Joe Stevens, M.D.

originalText.text: Doctor Armenakas has been my urologist for four years and I just have good thinks to say about him. Very experienced and human. Did not have the need see him after hours, but every time I called I got a call back.

originalText.text: Do not use this doctor.  I'm not talking about medical abilities.  Calls to his office or "emergency: service"  go unreturned.  Following a visit to ER there was no ability for this doctor to see the patient for a week.  There is total lack of concern for patient care or any kind of follow-up.
